title: Shaukat Aziz - Former Prime Minister of Pakistan - Chartwell Speakers Bureau

quotes: Shaukat Aziz left Citibank to join the government as Finance Minister in Pakistan, following a military takeover in 1999.
In 2001 Aziz was named ‘Finance Minister of the year’ by Euromoney magazine.
His driver died in his arms while they were leaving an election rally in Fateh Jang, a town in Attock, on 29 July 2004.
He was elected Prime Minister on 27 August 2004, and sworn in on the following day.
Pakistan’s GDP growth rocketed to 7.7% in 2005, averaging 4.9% during Aziz’s time in power, and poverty levels declined from 32.1% in 1999 to 17% in 2007.

In 2007 Aziz was appointed by UN Secretary-General Kofi Annan to co-chair a High-level Panel On UN Systemwide Coherence, along with Prime Minister Jens Stoltenberg of Norway and Prime Minister Luisa Diogo of Mozambique.

quotes: This eventually helped free the country from its draconian IMF programme and gave it economic sovereignty.
